result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Alexander Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with count 2 in 15CF1409 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for ONLY work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center, no other release privileges; with credit for 4 days (4-14-2015 to 4-17-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept.
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.


Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation, without a single violation of probation.

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Imposed and stayed pending probation review hearing on2-19-2016 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Alexander Ford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford not in court. Peter Hahn on behalf of Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for probation review hearing. Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with count 2 in 15CF1409 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for ONLY work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center, no other release privileges; with credit for 4 days (4-14-2015 to 4-17-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

AS TO COUNT 2 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction concurrent with count 1 in 15CF1409 and consecutive to any other sentence; release for ONLY work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center, no other release privileges; with credit for 4 days (4-14-2015 to 4-17-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed defendant on probation for 30 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNT 1:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Imposed and stayed pending probation review hearing on2-19-2016 at 1:30 pm, branch 17. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO COUNT 1 and 2:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $250.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTED the Defense request for expungement upon successfully completion of probation, without a single violation of probation.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Copy of letter withdrawing appeal on 13CM2427, 13CM2567 received and filed. tk

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Off the record discussion. Court notes this will be the last adjournment for a sentencing hearing. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 11-10-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.   Court addresses the Justice Point received and notes Defendant continues to comply.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 10-05-2015 received and filed. tk
Letters on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for sentencing hearing. For reasons placed on the record, case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 10-06-2015 at 8:30 pm, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated August 17, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Attorney Domask called prior to case being called and notified the Court that he is unavaliable for today's proceedings. Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing on 08-21-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated July 21, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 

AS TO COUNT 1 and 2 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

AS TO COUNT 3 -  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 11, 2015received and filed. tk

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case adjourned for projected Plea and Sentencing on 6-12-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated May 6, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Nicholas Cerwin for Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/22/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or  firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Antonio Alexander Ford in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
